About me

My name is Artur

Hello everyone and welcome to my portfolio webite :) I am a beginer Front-End Developer. Started to learn the basics of web development in Septermber 2022 and now can create websites and web apps with the help of HTML, CSS, SASS/SCSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, React, Git, GULP and BEM methotology. Now I am learning MERN stack. I am very disciplined and curious person and always finish what I started. I am unstoppable when it comes to Web Development because I completely fell in love with this sphere as it gives me freedom of creation and I try to implement my ideas into projects. I will be a life-long learner even after knowing all programming languages and technologies (which is impossible) as I believe that you need to always learn to achieve big things. I am planning to dive really deep in Web Development, learn Next.js, MySQL and TypeScript and become a Fullstack Engineer

Web-Development
Can create websites and web applications. In my work I use: HTML, CSS, SCSS/SASS, JavaScript, JQuerry, Git, GULP

Skills

What I use in my work

HTML5

HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It is a standard markup language for web page creation. It allows the creation and structure of sections, paragraphs, and links using HTML elements (the building blocks of a web page) such as tags and attributes.

CSS3

CSS is the language for describing the presentation of Web pages, including colors, layout, and fonts. It allows one to adapt the presentation to different types of devices, such as large screens, small screens, or printers. CSS is independent of HTML and can be used with any XML-based markup language.

JavaScript

JavaScript is a progrmamming language which allows you to make your website interactive. It allows for all the content you created with HTML and styled with CSS to become more engaging. From clickable buttons to log-in options, JavaScript is what turns your website from a wall of text into an experience.

React

React is an open-source JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly for web applications. It was developed and is maintained by Facebook and a community of individual developers. React allows developers to create reusable UI components and efficiently manage the state of their applications.

Redux

Redux is a state management library for JavaScript applications, commonly used with React, but it can be integrated with other libraries and frameworks as well. Redux provides a predictable state container that helps manage the state of an application in a consistent and organized manner.

Node.js

Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment that allows developers to execute JavaScript code outside of a web browser. It is built on the V8 JavaScript engine, which is the same engine used by Google Chrome, and it enables server-side execution of JavaScript code, making it ideal for building scalable and high-performance network applications.

Figma

Figma is a cloud-based design and prototyping tool that is particularly valuable for frontend developers during the design and development process. It enables collaboration among designers, developers, and other stakeholders, allowing them to work together seamlessly on web and app design projects.

SCSS/SASS

Sass and Scss are preprocessorcs of CSS which let you use features that do not exist in CSS, like variables, nested rules, mixins, imports, inheritance, built-in functions, and other stuff.

Bootstrap

Bootstrap makes responsive web design a reality. It makes it possible for a web page or app to detect the visitor's screen size and orientation and automatically adapt the display accordingly.
